newsitem.title: USA: St Paul Mayor unveils $381.8 mln FY 1998 budget.
newsitem.headline: St Paul Mayor unveils $381.8 mln FY 1998 budget.

text.p: St. Paul Mayor Norm Coleman has unveiled a proposed $381.8 million fiscal 1998 all-funds budget that includes $15 million of general obligation bonds for capital improvements, the city's finance director said Thursday.

Coleman's spending plan introduced to the City Council on Wednesday represents a $500,000 increase over the current fiscal year and cuts the property tax levy for the fourth consecutive year, Finance Director Joe Reid said.

Proceeds from the general obligation bonds will be used for street repairs, central library renovations and other projects, Reid said. St. Paul typically sells those bonds in February or March, he added.
Coleman has recommended a $700,000 increase in funding for snow removal and adding $200,000 to the library materials budget which will be matched by a $100,000 private donation, Reid said.
